intro: Phymatopsis kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong phymatopsis, is a flowering plant species native to southern China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer seasons. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
